summary: The Right to Equitable and Professional Auto Industry Repair Act (REPAIR Act) aims to ensure consumer access to vehicle data, critical repair information, and tools. It prohibits motor vehicle manufacturers from employing technological or legal barriers that restrict access for owners, repair facilities, and aftermarket parts providers. The bill establishes an advisory committee to make recommendations regarding implementation and competition in the auto repair industry. It also grants the Federal Trade Commission enforcement powers and regulates data privacy, specifying data usage and deletion protocols.
